issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

fields.summary: EBS volumes can't be mapped to partitions

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
*Assessment*

Currently we allow registering either /dev/sda1 or /dev/sda for the root device for EBS-backed EMIs.

*root device: /dev/sda1*
{code}
$ euca-register --name ebs-precise-raw-sda1 --snapshot snap-EFDB40A1 --root-device-name /dev/sda1 --region account1-user01@
IMAGE	emi-AFE03ECF
{code}
*root device: /dev/sda*
{code}
$ euca-register --name ebs-precise-raw-ephemeral --snapshot snap-EFDB40A1 --root-device-name /dev/sda -b "/dev/sdc=ephemeral0" --region account1-user01@
IMAGE	emi-81D53C0E
{code}
Both images boot just fine.  The issue is around the metadata service we respond with regarding the root device.  Instances launched from these images with both have the root device value of _/dev/sda_.

*root device: /dev/sda1*
{code}
ubuntu@euca-172-17-126-170:~$ curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/ami-id
emi-AFE03ECF

ubuntu@euca-172-17-126-170:~$ curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/block-device-mapping/root
/dev/sda
{code}

*root device: /dev/sda*
{code}
ubuntu@euca-172-17-126-176:~$ curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/ami-id
emi-81D53C0E

ubuntu@euca-172-17-126-176:~$ curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/block-device-mapping/root
/dev/sda
{code}

This behavior does not match AWS, this it is an AWS compatibility issue. 

*Signs*

* Comparison to AWS - two EBS-backed AMIs, one with root device of /dev/sda1 and the other with /dev/sda:
** root device: /dev/sda1
{code}
$ aws ec2 describe-images --image-ids ami-bdf3cdd4 --profile harold-work --output text
IMAGES	x86_64	xen	ami-bdf3cdd4	099720109477/ubuntu/images-testing/ebs/ubuntu-precise-daily-amd64-server-20140130	machine	aki-88aa75e1	ubuntu/images-testing/ebs/ubuntu-precise-daily-amd64-server-20140130	099720109477	True	/dev/sda1	ebs	available	paravirtual
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPINGS	/dev/sda1
EBS	True	snap-d8c467cf	8	standard
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPINGS	/dev/sdb	ephemeral0

## from within the instance based on this image ##
ubuntu@ip-10-239-43-10:~$ curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/block-device-mapping/root
/dev/sda1
{code}
** root device: /dev/sda
{code}
$ aws ec2 describe-images --image-ids ami-0da18864 --profile harold-work --output text
IMAGES	x86_64	Debian wheezy amd64 AMI (pvm)	xen	ami-0da18864	379101102735/debian-wheezy-amd64-pvm-131219	machine	aki-919dcaf8	debian-wheezy-amd64-pvm-131219	379101102735	True	/dev/sda	ebs	available	paravirtual
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPINGS	/dev/sda
EBS	True	snap-257fc239	8	standard

## from within the instance based on this image ##

admin@ip-10-9-128-125:~$ curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/block-device-mapping/root
/dev/sda
{code}
* Looking at euca-describe-images of both the EMIs, both show the root device as /dev/sda:
{code}
$ euca-describe-images emi-81D53C0E emi-AFE03ECF --region account1-user01@
IMAGE	emi-81D53C0E	961915002812/ebs-precise-raw-ephemeral	961915002812	available	private	x86_64	machine				ebs	hvm
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	/dev/sdc
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	/dev/sda	snap-EFDB40A1	6	true
IMAGE	emi-AFE03ECF	961915002812/ebs-precise-raw-sda1	961915002812	available	private	x86_64	machine				ebs	hvm
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	/dev/sda	snap-EFDB40A1	6	true
{code}
* INFO message in cloud-debug.log showing registration of EBS-backed EMI with /dev/sda1 root device:
{code}
Sat Feb 1 13:58:13 2014  INFO [Images:EucalyptusRequestQueue.199] [com.eucalyptus.images.Images.createFromDeviceMapping(Images.java):847
] Registering image pk=emi-AFE03ECF ownerId=arn:aws:euare::961915002812:user/user01
{code}
* Changed cloud.euca_log_level to TRACE, and re-ran EBS-backed EMI registration with /dev/sda1 as root.  Results from euca-register with --debug option enabled, and information in cloud-output.log:
** euca-register with --debug option:
{code}
$ euca-register --name ebs-precise-raw-sda1-v2 --snapshot snap-EFDB40A1 --root-device-name /dev/sda1 --region account1-user01@ --debug
2014-02-01 16:26:04,181 DEBUG   RegisterImage parsed arguments: {'VirtualizationType': None, 'BlockDeviceMapping': [], 'Description': None, 'url': None, 'key_id': None, 'shell_configfile': '', 'userregion': 'account1-user01@', 'snapshot': 'snap-EFDB40A1', 'Architecture': None, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'ImageLocation': None, 'KernelId': None, 'RamdiskId': None, 'secret_key': None, 'deprecated_key_id': None, 'RootDeviceName': '/dev/sda1', 'Name': 'ebs-precise-raw-sda1-v2'}
2014-02-01 16:26:04,181 DEBUG   Config current user set to 'account1-user01'
2014-02-01 16:26:04,182 DEBUG   Config searching regions for option 'ec2-url'
2014-02-01 16:26:04,182 DEBUG   Config   section 'LayinDaSmackDown'
2014-02-01 16:26:04,182 INFO    Config option 'ec2-url' = 'http://10.104.1.216:8773/services/Eucalyptus'
2014-02-01 16:26:04,182 DEBUG   Config searching regions for option 'verify-ssl'

2014-02-01 16:26:04,182 INFO    Config option 'verify-ssl' not found
2014-02-01 16:26:04,182 DEBUG   Config searching users for option 'key-id'
2014-02-01 16:26:04,182 DEBUG   Config   section 'account1-user01'
2014-02-01 16:26:04,182 INFO    Config option 'key-id' = 'AKIYO5GIWPS4VIRN7ZU2'
2014-02-01 16:26:04,183 DEBUG   Config searching users for option 'secret-key'
2014-02-01 16:26:04,183 DEBUG   Config   section 'account1-user01'
2014-02-01 16:26:04,183 INFO    Config option 'secret-key' = <redacted>
2014-02-01 16:26:04,187 INFO    RegisterImage parameters: {'BlockDeviceMapping.1.DeviceName': '/dev/sda1', 'Version': '2013-02-01', 'Name': 'ebs-precise-raw-sda1-v2', 'Action': 'RegisterImage', 'BlockDeviceMapping.1.Ebs.SnapshotId': 'snap-EFDB40A1', 'RootDeviceName': '/dev/sda1'}
2014-02-01 16:26:04,187 INFO    Eucalyptus sending request (attempt 1 of 3)
2014-02-01 16:26:04,189 DEBUG   EC2CompatibleQuerySigV2Auth string to sign: 'POST\n10.104.1.216:8773\n/services/Eucalyptus\nAWSAccessKeyId=AKIYO5GIWPS4VIRN7ZU2&Action=RegisterImage&BlockDeviceMapping.1.DeviceName=%2Fdev%2Fsda1&BlockDeviceMapping.1.Ebs.SnapshotId=snap-EFDB40A1&Name=ebs-precise-raw-sda1-v2&RootDeviceName=%2Fdev%2Fsda1&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2014-02-01T16%3A26%3A04Z&Version=2013-02-01'

{code}
Sat Feb 1 16:26:12 2014  INFO [Images:EucalyptusRequestQueue.208] [com.eucalyptus.images.Images.createFromDeviceMapping(Images.java):847] Registering image pk=emi-EB414387 ownerId=arn:aws:euare::961915002812:user/user01
Sat Feb 1 16:26:12 2014 TRACE [AtomicMarkedState:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#17] [com.eucalyptus.records.BaseRecord.trace(BaseRecord.java):179] :1391271972576:AtomicMarkedState:TRANSITION_FUTURE:set(ServiceConfiguration properties arn:euca:bootstrap:properties:10.104.1.216/ 10.104.1.216:8773:/services/Properties:vm-local:host-local:ENABLED:com.eucalyptus.component.EphemeralConfiguration)

Sat Feb 1 16:26:12 2014 TRACE [ServiceContext:ReplyQueue.1305] [com.eucalyptus.records.BaseRecord.trace(BaseRecord.java):179] :1391271972665:ServiceContext:670652b3-3c43-4d09-aaaf-3078309a03b9:arn:aws:euare:961915002812:user/user01:MSG_REPLY:670652b3-3c43-4d09-aaaf-3078309a03b9:RegisterImageResponseType:8463.429 ms
{code}

*Steps*

* Set up Eucalyptus 3.4.1 Cloud
* Download and source admin user credentials from eucalyptus account
* Create keypair (e.g. euca-admin):
{code}
$ euca-create-keypair euca-admin > euca-admin.priv
$ chmod 0600 euca-admin.priv
{code}
* Download tar-gzipped precise-server-cloudimg:
{code}
$ wget http://cloud-images.ubuntu.com/precise/current/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64.tar.gz
{code}
* Create an instance stored-backed EMI using eustore:
{code}
$ eustore-install-image -t precise-server-cloudimg-amd64.tar.gz -b ubuntu-latest-precise-x86_64 --hypervisor universal -s "Ubuntu Cloud Image - Precise Pangolin - 12.04 LTS"
{code}
* Run instance using that EMI (for example):
{code}
$ euca-run-instances -t m1.medium -k euca-admin emi-5C8C3909
{code}
* Create a volume based upon the size of how big you want the root filesystem to be (for example):
{code}
$ euca-create-volume -s 6 -z LayinDaSmackDown
{code}
* Attach the volume to the running instance (for example):
{code}
$ euca-attach-volume -d /dev/vdd -i i-839E3FB0 vol-B5863B3B
{code}
* SSH into the instance and download the Ubuntu Precise Cloud Image (qcow2 format):
{code}
$ ssh -i euca-admin.priv ubuntu@euca-10-104-7-10.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
# sudo -s
# wget http://cloud-images.ubuntu.com/precise/current/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img
{code}
* Install qemu-utils
{code}
# apt-get install -y qemu-utils
{code}
* Convert image from qcow2 to raw:
{code}
# qemu-img convert -O raw precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1-raw.img
{code}
* dd raw image to block device where volume is attached (use dmesg to figure that out easily):
{code}
# dmesg | tail
[ 7026.943212] virtio-pci 0000:00:05.0: using default PCI settings
[ 7026.943249] pci 0000:00:07.0: no hotplug settings from platform
[ 7026.943251] pci 0000:00:07.0: using default PCI settings
[ 7026.945964] virtio-pci 0000:00:07.0: enabling device (0000 -> 0003)
[ 7026.955143] virtio-pci 0000:00:07.0: PCI INT A -> Link[LNKC] -> GSI 10 (level, high) -> IRQ 10
[ 7026.955180] virtio-pci 0000:00:07.0: setting latency timer to 64
[ 7026.955429] virtio-pci 0000:00:07.0: irq 45 for MSI/MSI-X
[ 7026.955456] virtio-pci 0000:00:07.0: irq 46 for MSI/MSI-X
[ 7026.986990]  vdb: unknown partition table
[10447.093426] virtio-pci 0000:00:07.0: PCI INT A disabled

# dd if=/mnt/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1-raw.img of=/dev/vdb bs=1M
{code}
* Log out the instance, and detach the volume (for example):
{code}
$ euca-detach-volume vol-B5863B3B
{code}
* Create a snapshot of the volume:
{code}
$ euca-create-snapshot vol-B5863B3B
{code}
* Register the snapshot to create the EBS-backed EMI with /dev/sda root device name:
{code}
$ euca-register --name EBS-Precise-sda --snapshot snap-EFDB40A1 --root-device-name /dev/sda
{code}
* Register the snapshot to create the EBS-backed EMI with /dev/sda1 root device name:
{code}
$ euca-register --name EBS-Precise-sda1 --snapshot snap-EFDB40A1 --root-device-name /dev/sda1
{code}
* Run instances from both of the EMIs; observe the output from running curl against the following metadata category:
{code}
http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/block-device-mapping/root
{code}
It should match the root device name option passed to register the EBS-backed EMI.
fields.summary: Inconsistent Block Device Mapping Behavior For Root Device Metadata
fields.environment:
*non-HA, single-cluster*

comments.body: Please see EUCA-7167 for explanation why you can't register bfEBS image with --root-device-name /dev/sda1.
Closing as won't fix. The issue should be re-evaluated if support for PV bfEBS images is added to Eucalypus.

I agree that until Euca can boot PV EBS images, the inconsistency introduced in EUCA-7167 is probably preferable to the alternative (we're AWS-incompatible either way).

I am curious, [~hspencer], if the image that you registered on AWS with {{sda1}} ({{ubuntu/images-testing/ebs/ubuntu-precise-daily-amd64-server-20140130}}) is a partition image (not a disk)?
